page.title: 10Day in the life of a farmer
page.content:
Farmer Brown and his son David who is seventeen years of age start work each morning at 06.30 hrs.First farmer Brown switches on the equipment in the milking parlour. David and his collie dog go and collect the cows from the field and bring them up the lane and into the milking parlour. The whole milking operation lasts one and a half hours. The cows are then taken to the field opposite the dwelling house to graze.
About this time Mrs. Brown will have breakfast ready. Breakfast consists of cereals, toast and a fry. An Ulster Fry consists of bacon, eggs, and fried bread. The next job to be done is feeding the calves and pigs. After that David hooks on the silage cutter and goes to cut grass. When he returns he will again milk the cows.
